Other similar evidence of the Reds’ fear of VGA’s effect on their sub¬
ject peoples comes from their own efforts, particularly in East Germany,
to prevent listening to the VcicSo The Communist leaders frequently attack
those who listen and in several Cases of trumped-up trials of their victims,
listening to the VGA has been cited as contributing to the defendant’s
“treason®st A Chinese university professor has described VGA in a newspaper
article as “ten thousand times more destructive than the atom bomb because
the bomb can damage only limited areas, while the Voice of America corrupts
every person who listens to its enticing broadcasts®w A Soviet journalist
declared that the Voice of America had become “synonymous with lying and
provocational fiction to millions of Soviet people®”
But the best proof that the Communists regard the Voice as a threat to
their designs is the magnitude of the Soviet Union’s effort to jam VGA broad¬
casts® This activity, occupying the services of a large staff of badly needed
